name: KWS SDK
text: The SuperAwesome KWS SDK (Software Development Kit) lets you to easily integrate third-party apps with KWS.

sections.name: Introduction
sections.text:
This document will help you get started with the integration of your application with the SuperAwesome Club. It describes how you will interact with our APIs and what the user journey will look like.

The diagrams are color coded to allow you to quickly identify what kind of interactions are involved:

  • The interactions with the user are in orange.
  • The redirections are in light blue.
  • The websockets are in green.
  • The other interactions are in red.

Each diagram are accompanied with a detailed description of these interactions. The interactions that you will have to implement in your application are in black. The interactions that are performed by our SDKs or by our platform are in grey.

sections.name: APIs
sections.text:
Our platform offers two APIs:

  • The Application API: It allows you to perform requests on behalf of your application. The majority of the actions that do not require an authenticated user fall into this category.
  • The User API: It allows you to perform an operation on behalf on an authenticated user.

sections.name: Application API
sections.text:
The operation that you can perform include, for example:

  • Users:
    • List all the users of the application
    • Reading their data (i.e. the emails), if you are authorised to do so
  • Notifications:
    • List the notifications sent by your application
    • Notify the users
  • Events: (the events are used to reward Awesome Points through transactions)
    • Create new events
  • Transactions:
    • List all the transactions of your application (to find out when and how you awarded points to users)
  • Treasure hunts:
    • List the treasure hunts running on your application
    • Set up a new treasure hunt
    • Create new treasure hunt placements (to control where the items will appear)
  • Painting competitions:
    • Create new competitions
    • Approve/reject the entries
    • Download the entries

This will also allow you to perform more high level operations. For example:

  • See how many points were awarded by your application
  • Set which permissions your application will require

These operations can also be performed directly through our dashboard.

If you need to call the Application API, the flow will be:

  1. The user will perform an action on your application
  2. This will trigger an ajax request to your backend
  3. Your backend will call a function of our SDK
  4. Our SDK will make a request to our API
  5. Our API will process the request and send a response
  6. Our SDK will process the response and send it to your application
  7. Your application will process the response and send it back to the frontend
  8. The fronted will process the response and update the page

If you call the Application API via a script, only the steps 3-6 will apply.

If you use our dashboard, you will be the user and only 1 and 8 will apply.

sections.name: User API
sections.text:
The operation that you can perform include, for example:

  • Points:
    • Get the balance of the current user
    • Get an history of the transactions
  • Notifications:
    • Get the notifications of the user
    • “Read” notifications
  • Games:
    • Get the rank of the user
    • Submit scores
  • Painting competitions:
    • Submit entries

These operations can be performed from the frontend or from the backend of your application.

From the backend, the flow is the same as the Application API.

From the frontend:

  1. The user will perform an action on your application
  2. This will trigger a call to our API
  3. Our SDK will make a request to our API
  4. Our API will process the request and send a response
  5. Our SDK will process the response and send it to your application
  6. Your application will process the response and update the page

sections.name: Data Notifications
sections.text:
To allow you to create a dynamic website, the frontend version of our User API also allows you to listen some changes. For example, you can listen to leaderboards, to allow the users to view the latest scores without having to refresh the page.

For example, internally in the Awesome Bar, we listen to:

  • The current user notifications, to display them in real time.
  • The current user, to update the current balance of the user.

  1. The user visits a page or perform an action on a page
  2. This will trigger a call to our API
  3. When an update is available, it will automatically be sent to you
  4. Our SDK will process it and send it to your listener
  5. Your application will process it and update the page

sections.name: NodeJs
sections.text:
To include our backend SDK, simply add the following dependency to your project:

{
    “dependencies”{
        “superawesome”: “https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/tmp-fix-github-ddos/sa-platform-node-sdk-7370c7401677685c0fd8338452083a64f6b5e3ce.tar.gz”
    }
}

To use it, require the module and instantiate the Application API with your api keys.

var SuperAwesomeAppApi = require('superawesome');
var saAppApi = new SuperAwesomeAppApi({
    saAppId: ‘mlp-friendship-club’, 
    saAppApiKey: ‘z7IIRjPePAgP4i8M2fjYWoYPmWi2tVc3’,
    saPlatformUrl: ‘https://staging.superawesome.club’,
    loginRedirectUrl: ‘/go/there/after/login’,
    logoutRedirectUrl: ‘/go/there/after/logout’
});

Then, add our router to your express application:

app.use(saAppApi.router);

This will:

  • Add the urls needed to implement the authentication (see below).
  • On every request, it will give you access to the User API by adding the req.saUserApi attribute to the request.

You can modify where the user will be redirected after the login/logout by modifying respectively loginRedirectUrl and logoutRedirectUrl.

sections.name: Javascript
sections.text:
To include our frontend SDK, add the following script to all the pages of your project:

<script src="https://staging.superawesome.club/sdk/sdk.js"></script>

To use it, instantiate the User API:

var saUserApi = new SuperAwesomeUserApi({
    saAppId: ‘mlp-friendship-club’
});

sections.name: Login
sections.text:
1. The user will click on the login button on your website

  1. The click handler will call our frontend SDK
<button class="sa_sign_in" onclick="saUserApi.authentication.signIn()"></button>

  1. The user will be redirected to the SuperAwesome Club
  2. The user will arrive to our login/account creation page

  1. The user will login or create an account
  2. The user will be redirected to your backend
  3. Our router will handle the request
  4. Our backend SDK will check with the club that the authentication is valid
  5. The club will send back the information needed to complete the process
  6. Our backend SDK will do an internal redirection to the page of your choice (by default, the homepage)
  7. You will render that page
  8. And show the user that he is authenticated
saUserApi.authentication.getUser().then(function(user){ 
    // Do something
})

sections.name: Actions
sections.text:
The points are awarded through events.

Each event has a unique token that can be used to trigger the event for the current user.

saUserApi.events.triggerEventWithToken({token: 'abcdefg', points: 5});

The maximum number of points that you can award is set on the event.

This can be done from the frontend and the backend.

When you need to allow the user to “redeem a code”, you can simply ask them for the code and then use it as the token of the event.

sections.name: Notifications
sections.text:
Notifications can be sent only from the backend of your application.

saUserApi.notifications.notify({
    description: 'This is a notification',
    targetUserIds: [userId]
});

A notification can be sent to multiple users at the same time.

To check if a user has performed an action, you can trigger a specific event and award 0 points to the user. For example, this can be used to check if a user has already watched a video.

sections.name: Badges
sections.text:
You don’t need to store badges / ranks. Instead, you can compute them dynamically when needed. Example: (from the backend. Remove the req. for the frontend)

return Promise.all([
    req.saUserApi.games.getGameScores({gameIds: ['???', '???']}),
    req.saUserApi.events.hasTriggeredEvents({eventIds: [1, 2, 3]})
]).spread(function (scores, triggeredEvents) {

});

sections.name: Treasure Hunt
sections.text:
The treasure hunt items are displayed through treasure hunt placements

saUserApi.treasureHunts.getPlacementElement({placementId: 999999})
    .then(function (element) {
        $(element).appendTo($('fooBar'));
    })

Most of the time, getPlacementElement won’t return anything. From time to time, it will return a DOM element containing the image. If the user clicks on the image, he will trigger an event, get a notification and be redirected the the page defined on the treasure hunt item.

]

On this page, you can then show which items have been found / are still to find.

saUserApi.events.hasTriggeredEvents({eventIds: [991, 992, 993, 994]})
    .then(function (result) {
        // ....
    })

sections.name: Daily Event
sections.text:
Daily Event

To reward points, trigger the event using triggerEventWithToken.

You can check if the user already triggered the daily event that day with hasTriggeredEvents.

sections.name: Downloads
sections.text:
To reward points, trigger the event using triggerEventWithToken.

You can check if the user already triggered the daily event that day with hasTriggeredEvents.

  • Events
    • 1 event per download per day.
    • Number of downloads: 30.

sections.name: Competitions
sections.text:
The competitions are displayed through game elements

saUserApi.games.getGameElement({gameId: '55c47f46118da01291a814ac'})
    .then(function(game) {
        $('.competition’).append(game);
    });

The competition will be responsive. To resize the competition, simply resize its container (in this example .competition).

sections.name: Invite a Friend
sections.text:
To allow a user to invite a friend, simply collect the email and call users.inviteUser()

saUserApi.users.inviteUser({email: 'test@example.com'})

sections.name: Leaderboards
sections.text:
You can get a snapshot of a leaderboard from the backend and the frontend of your application.

From the frontend, you can also listen for updates to award the leaderboards as soon as the scores are submitted.

saUserApi.games.addGameLeaderBoardListener({gameId: '?????'}),
    function (leaderBoard) {
        // ....
    }
);

From the backend, you can get the leaderboard of the application

saUserApi.games.getApplicationScore({
    // Be careful, month index starts at 0 in javascript...
    start: new Date(2015, 6, 10),
    end: new Date(2015, 7, 11)
}).then(function(response){
    // Do something
})

sections.name: Friendship Map
sections.text:
Note: The following endpoint is only accessible from the application api as it contains information that the owner of the application might want to keep private. You’ll need to use the latest version:

https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/tmp-fix-github-ddos/sa-platform-node-sdk-a300741a0cdfe50391d84463b6434d88cf3131bc.tar.gz

saAppApi.users.getUsersMap().then(function(response){
    // Do something
})

The results will be an objects mapping ISO 3166-2 to the number of users in that area:

{
    'GB-CON': {name: "Cornwall", count: 91},
    'GB-COV': {name: "Coventry", count: 16},
    'GB-CRF': {name: "Cardiff", count: 42},
    'GB-CRY': {name: "Croydon", count: 62},
    // ...
}

Note: If you have some problems transforming these results into an image, please let us know and we will help you.

Note: The endpoint is not yet fully implemented on our side so at the moment you’ll always receive the same result.

sections.name: Errors
sections.text:
Error name Meaning in the app api Meaning in the user api
AuthenticationError Wrong app api key The user is not authenticated
AuthorisationError You don’t have enough rights to perform the operation
For example, the requested feature is not enabled for your app		 You don’t have enough rights to perform the operation
For example, your are trying to get points with an event to this app
ValidationError Incorrect parameters Incorrect parameters
Error Any other error Any other error

sections.name: Application API
sections.text:
Method
saAppApi.notifications.notify(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
targetUserIds array of integers [ ] the ids of the users of your application that should receive the notification
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved without data if the notification was sent successfully
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getUserId
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.authentication.getUserId()
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the id of the current user
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getUser
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.authentication.getUser()
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the current user. Example: 
    {
    id: 42,
    username: ‘MyUsername’
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: hasTriggeredEvent
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.events.hasTriggeredEvent(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
eventId integer the id of the event
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with true if the user has triggered the event, false otherwise
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: hasTriggeredEvents
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.events.hasTriggeredEvents(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
eventIds array of integers [ ] the ids of the events
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with an object mapping the event ids to booleans indicating if the events have been triggered. 
    {
    101: true,
    102: false,
    103: true,
    ...
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: triggerEventWithToken
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.events.triggerEventWithToken(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
token string a unique token that identifies the event
points integer the number of points defined on the event the number of points to give to the user
  • min: 0
  • max: the number of points defined on the event
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved if the points were awarded successfully
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getGame
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getGame(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
gameId integer the id of the game
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with a game object 
    {
    id: 42,
    name: ‘Game abc’,
    // Indicates if the best score is the maximum or the minimum
    bestScoreFunction: ‘min’ 
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getGameScore
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getGameScore(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
gameId integer the id of the game
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the global score of the user in the game (across all the levels) 
    {
    score: 999,
    rank: 1234
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getGamesScores
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getGamesScores(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
gameIds array of integers the ids of the games
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with an object mapping the game ids to the global score of the user in the games (across all the levels, respectively) 
    {
    1: {
        score: 999,
        rank: 1234
    },
    2: {
        score: 998,
        rank: 1237
    }
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getGameLeaderboard
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getGameLeaderBoard(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
gameId integer the id of the game
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the leaderboard of the game 
    {
    // Number of scores
    count: 123,
    // Size of the current page (pagination not yet implemented)
    limit: 10,
    // Index of the first result of the page (pagination not yet implemented)
    offset: 0,
    results: [
        {
            score: 999
            rank: 1,
            user: {
                id: 125,
                username: ‘User 125’
            }
        },
        {
            score: 1005
            rank: 2,
            user: {
                id: 15,
                username: ‘User 15’
            }
        }
    ]
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getLevelScore
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getLevelScore(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
levelId integer the id of the level
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the global score of the user in the level 
    {
    score: 999,
    rank: 1234
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getLevelLeaderboard
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getLevelLeaderBoard(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
levelId integer the id of the level
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the leaderboard of the level 
    {
    // Number of scores
    count: 123,
    // Size of the current page (pagination not yet implemented)
    limit: 10,
    // Index of the first result of the page (pagination not yet implemented)
    offset: 0,
    results: [
        {
            score: 999
            rank: 1,
            user: {
                id: 125,
                username: ‘User 125’
            }
        },
        {
            score: 1005
            rank: 2,
            user: {
                id: 15,
                username: ‘User 15’
            }
        }
    ]
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getApplicationScore
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getApplicationScore(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
start Date start date for the query
end Date end date for the query
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the score of the user in the app between the given dates 
    {
    score: 12,
    rank: 7
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getApplicationLeaderBoard
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getAppLeaderBoard(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
start Date start date for the query
end Date end date for the query
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the leaderboard of the app between the given dates 
    {
    count: 26,
    limit: 20,
    offset: 0,
    results: [
        {
            rank: 1,
            score: 52,
            user: "FooBar1"
        },
        {
            rank: 2,
            score: 51,
            user: "FooBar2"
        },
        // ...
    ]
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: submitScore
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.submitScore(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
levelId integer the id of the level
score float the score of the user
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the highscore of the user in the level
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getNotifications
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.getNotifications()
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the info of the pending notifications 
    {
     // Number of notifications
    count: 123,
    // Size of the current page (pagination not yet implemented)
    limit: 10,
    // Index of the first result of the page (pagination not yet implemented)
    offset: 0,
    results: [
        {
            id: 1005,
            appId: 2,
            description: ‘Congratulations!’,
            url: ‘http://www.example.com’,
            // Date object
            date: …, 
            // Whether the notification has already been seen by the user
            read: false
        }
    ]
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: readNotification
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.notifications.readNotification(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
notificationId integer the id of the notification
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved if the notification has been read successfully
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getGameStatistics
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.points.getGameStatistics()
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the total points awarded by the game. Example: 
    {
    totalPointsAwarded: 999
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: getApplicationStatistics
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.points.getApplicationStatistics()
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with the total points awarded by the application. Example: 
    {
    totalPointsAwarded: 999
}
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: signIn
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.authentication.signIn()
Action
Start the sign in/sign up process. This will redirect the user.

sections.name: signOut
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.authentication.signOut()
Action
Sign out the user. This will redirect the user

sections.name: User Listener
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.authentication.addUserListener(callback)
Action
The callback will be called every time the user is updated (username/data updated, points won, …)
The callback will receive the same parameters as the success handler of authentication.getUser()

sections.name: Level Listener
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.addLevelLeaderBoardListener(callback)
Action
The callback will be called every time the leaderboard is updated.
The parameters are the same as games.getLevelLeaderboard()
The callback will receive the same parameters as the success handler of games.getLevelLeaderboard()

sections.name: Game Listener
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.games.addGameLeaderBoardListener(callback)
Action
The callback will be called every time the leaderboard is updated.
The parameters are the same as games.getGameLeaderboard()
The callback will receive the same parameters as the success handler of games.getGameLeaderboard()

sections.name: Statistics Listener
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.points.addStatisticsListener(callback)
Action
The callback will be called every time the balance of the user is updated.
The callback will receive the same parameters as the success handler of points.getStatistics()

sections.name: Notifications Listener
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.notifications.addNewNotificationListener(callback)
Action
The callback will be called every time the user receives a new notification.
The callback will receive an object with the same properties as one of the results received by the success handler of notifications.getNotifications()

sections.name: Get Placement
sections.text:
Method
saUserApi.treasureHunts.getPlacementElement(parameters)
Parameters
name type default comment
placementId integer the ids of the placement
Response
A promise that will:
  • be resolved with a DOM element containing the treasure hunt item
    • or
  • be rejected with an error

sections.name: Technical Support
sections.text: If you have any questions or you need technical support, please, do not hesitate to contact us at devsupport@superawesome.tv. We will make every attempt to answer your inquiry as quickly as possible.
